Introducing Laurent Ferrier Grand Sport Tourbillon, now with a blue dial and steel bracelet

The Grand Sport Tourbillon was unveiled a year ago as Laurent Ferrier's vision of a high-end luxury sports watch, mixing a very common case material such as steel, with a delicate, entirely hand-finished tourbillon movement. LAURENT FERRIER Tourbillon Grand Sport

Laurent Ferrier, known today as an independent master watchmaker, was seen on the roster of some of the most prestigious car races until the 70s. He competed in the legendary 24 Hours of Le Mans seven times, even finishing first in the two-liter prototype category in 1977.
